definitions.body: Shₑbâ in SW.Arabia (Sab. [[סבא]] DHM:ZMG xxxvii (1883), 9, [[סבא]] vb. = make campaign Mordt:HI 72 or expedition Sab. Denkm.:No.12, 1. 5, 14; cf. DSMargoliouth:Hast DB SHEBA FB:Ency.Bib. SHEBA and reff);—Sheba: ´[[מַלְכַּת־שׁ]]: 1Ki 10:1, 1Ki 10:4, 1Ki 10:10, 1Ki 10:13 = 2Ch 9:1, 2Ch 9:3, 2Ch 9:9, 2Ch 9:12; ´[[מַלְכֵי שׁ]]: Ps 72:10; famous for trade,´[[רׂכְלֵי שׁ]]: Ez Eze 27:22, Eze 27:23, ´[[הֲלִיכׂת שׁ]]: Job 6:19 (‖[[תֵּמָא ]]); yielding costly wares Ez Eze 38:13, ´[[זְהַב שׁ]]: Ps 72:15, ´[[לְבוֹנׇה מִשּׁ]]: Je 6:20 (‖[[מֵאֶרֶץ מֶרְחָק ]], cf. foll.), paying homage and tribute to Israel in future Is 60:6; descended from (Yoḳtan and) Shem Ge 10:28 (J) = 1Ch 1:22, from (Yoḳshan and) Abr. and Ḳeṭûrâh Ge 25:3 (J ?) = 1Ch 1:32 (i.e. a northern branch of Sheba, + [[דְּדָן]], q.v.), but from [[כּוּשׁ]] Ge 10:7 (P) = 1Ch 1:9; marauders, N.Arabia, Job 1:15
